result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael A Worlin was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond if posted is forfeited and remainder is due within 60 days.  If not paid within 60 days, all available enforcements will be taken.
Defendant is to report to ICJ within 12 months of sentencing date.  Defendant is eligible for Good Time and Huber at the discretion of the Iron County Sheriff.
Defendant is to check with TAD officer on requirements of an AODA.  If one is required, def shall participate and follow through with recommendations.
45 days of additional jail time is suspended pending completion of one year in the TAD program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Worlin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael A Worlin in court with attorney Douglas Muskett.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  DA states agreement for court.  Court to honor agreement.  Jason Sedovic addresses court re TAD program.  Court explains sentence to def.  Court sentences def to $2010, 26 month revoc., 45 days ICS with Good Time and Huber, to be served within one year of this date.  If def does not complete the TAD program, an additional 45 days are to be served in ICJ.  12 month IID, AODA if required, Mr. Sedovic to look into AODA.  DNA has already been given in Ashland.  Court further addresses def.  Adjourned at 11:36 a.m.  klr
Sentencing hearing on June 13, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on May 23, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Worlin in court with attorney Douglas Musket.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 3:34 p.m.  Cites appearances.  Gives court background.  Court to take plea today and sentencing to be scheduled.  Def pleads NC to Count #1.  No coercion.  PLQ filed and def admits completing.  Sentencing to be scheduled in 30 days.  All TRs are dismissed by Court as well as Counts #2 and #3.  Bond continues.  Adjourned at 3:38 p.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 10, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Michael A. Worling appeared with Attorney Douglas Musket.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases at 11:00 a.m.  Parties have discussed matters.  Def would like to discuss TAD program.  Court explains program.  DA requests 30-day adjournment.  Court grants adjournment.  Bond to continue.  Adjourned at 11:04 a.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 28, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael A Worlin in court with attorney James Donald McKenzie.   Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases (including 16TR194, 198, and 251) and cites appearances.  Was set for plea and sentencing-requests adjournment until after February 26th.  Court grants adjournment.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael A Worlin in court with attorney James Donald McKenzie.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases, cites appearances.  Initial in 16CM74:  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint and pleads NG.  Court directs clerk to enter NG pleas.  To be scheduled.  Bond continues and covers all cases.  16CT5, 16TR198,194 and 251 are all set for PTC to be held.  klr
